definition: to wait/to inquire after/to watch/season/climate/(old) period of five days

sentences.english: I am at your command, Mr. District-Attorney.
sentences.chinese: 檢察官先生，我靜候您的處理。

sentences.english: A female lion squatted in the shrub, waiting for her games.
sentences.chinese: 一隻母獅蜷伏在灌木叢中，靜候着她的獵物。

sentences.english: “God, ” he said, and waited for the laugh.
sentences.chinese: “上帝啊，”他自語，靜候“笑聲”的出現。

sentences.english: And we wait, on each bank of the Milky Way, for that single day to come.
sentences.chinese: 我們靜候着，在銀河兩畔，等待着那一天的到來。

sentences.english: We are waiting for their closer information.
sentences.chinese: 我們在靜候他們進一步的消息。

sentences.english: I have been waiting for more than three years to write this column.
sentences.chinese: 三年多來我一直靜候時機能寫這麼個專欄。

sentences.english: I heard a clear music" autumn", with eyes closed for autumn Pro falls.
sentences.chinese: 我聽一曲清清音樂《秋》，閉眼靜候深秋的臨落。

sentences.english: Yet quietly my captain awaits my silence.
sentences.chinese: 但我的船長還在靜候着我的沉寂。

definition: (of alcohol) to ferment/(of a crisis) to be brewing/to mull over (an issue)/to hold exploratory discussions
to apply (for a job)/to reply to a job advertisement
(formal) to honor with one's presence/to attend
to snatch time/to rush/to hurry (up)/to seize the moment
preparation/to prepare/to intend/to be about to/reserve (fund)
in a little while/in a moment/later on
"Red Poppies", novel by 阿來|阿来[A1 lai2]
lit. the dust has settled (idiom)/fig. to get sorted out/to be finalized
